title: Album Page, "Plan of Pillars in Church and 6th Window, Possibly from Abbey of Chiaravalle, Milan", late 19th century
medium: Graphite on very smooth, off-white wove paper tipped into binding with fabric
inscribed:
Recto, in graphite, top edge of sheet: Plan of pillars in church / entrance aisle / altar; below this: 6th window / 1.85 = height of sill from top of balcony with the / su..ar bays on it; sill / section / plan. There are various inscriptions related to the components rendered.  

Verso, in graphite, upper right corner: 100.
dimensions: Sheet: 30.7 x 19.7 cm (12 1/16 x 7 3/4 in.), irregular
description: Vertical sheet illustrating plan view of pillars; below is a sketch of a single round-arched window supported by a slender column.  Below this is a plan view of the window opening and column as well as a view of the same in section.  The sheet also contains various inscriptions with the dimensions of the elements rendered.

tombstone.epitaph: Album Page, "Plan of Pillars in Church and 6th Window, Possibly from Abbey of Chiaravalle, Milan", late 19th century.Graphite on very smooth, off-white wove paper tipped into binding with fabric. Gift of Mrs. William Greenough. 1943-51-263.
